intro: Spilanthes stenophylla, commonly known as narrow-leaf toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The species is known for its pungent odor and has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties.
